title: void_termina_(final_core)
body: The final form [[Void Termina]] takes in [i][[Kirby Star Allies]][/i]. The Final Core is a purple, gooey sphere inside the [[Void Termina (First Core)|First Core]] whose face morphs to resemble [[Kirby]] or [[Dark Matter (Kirby)|]]. [spoiler]In Soul Melter and Soul Melter EX, the Final Core is replaced with [[Void Soul]] and [[Void (Kirby)|]] respectively.[/spoiler]

title: void_termina_(first_core)
body: The second form [[Void Termina]] takes in [i][[Kirby Star Allies]][/i]. It appears as a red and orange orgranic shell which has the [[Void Termina (Final Core)|Final Core]] inside. [spoilers]In Soul Melter and Soul Melter EX, [[Void Soul]] and [[Void (Kirby)|]] are inside respectively.[/spoiler]

title: void_termina_(angel_form)
body: The third form [[Void Termina]] takes in [i][[Kirby Star Allies]][/i]. Like his His [[Void Termina (Demon God Form)|Demon God Form]], he is giant with a white mask, but his arms and legs are replaced with wings and a tail. In Soul Melter EX, he appears with a darker [[official alternate color]].

title: void_termina_(demon_god_form)
body:
The first form [[Void Termina]] takes in [i][[Kirby Star Allies]][/i]. He appears as a giant with a white mask, horns, and arms and legs. In Soul Melter EX, he appears with a darker [[official alternate color]].

His [[Void Termina (Angel Form)|Angel Form]] is similar, but has wings and a tail instead of arms and legs.

title: presenting_another
body:
A sub category of [[presenting]]. When a character(s) holds another body in a position that signifies that they're ready for [[sex]]. Often this means being [[bent over]] with their [[ass]] towards their partner, or lying [[on back]] with [[spread legs]], [[spread pussy|labia]], or [[spread anus|butt]].

Summed up by the phrase: "You want it? Come and get it!"
See [[presenting]] for self gesturing.
See [[take your pick]] for when multiple characters are presenting a choice.

For presenting an actual gift or item, see [[gift]], [[giving]], or [[incoming gift]].

title: gau-8
body:
A seven-barrel 30mm [[Gatling gun]]-type [[weapon]] which equips the [[A-10 Thunderbolt II]] [[jet]] and the Dutch Goalkeeper close-in weapon system. The A-10-installed system is 6.06 meters (19.88 feet) long and, when fully loaded with ammunition, weighs 1,828 kg (4,029 pounds).

Notable for its "BRRRT" sound when firing.

title: typhoon_(kamen_rider)
body:
The first [[rider belt]] introduced in [[Kamen Rider]], used by [[Kamen Rider 1]] and [[Kamen Rider 2]].

2015's [[Kamen Rider 3]] and [[Kamen Rider 4]], being based on the originals, also use the Typhoon. Adaptations based on the [[kamen rider (1st series)|original Kamen Rider]], such as [[Kamen Rider the First]] and [[Shin Kamen Rider]], also feature their own iterations of the Typhoon, whether for their versions of No. 1 and No. 2, or for original characters such as [[Kamen Rider 0]].

title: poppy_bros_sr
body:
Poppy Bros Sr. are recurring mid-boss enemies from the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby series]] that grant the "bomb" ability. They look like clowns, and hop around while tossing bombs at [[Kirby]] to attack. For the smaller, common variant, see [[poppy_bros_jr|Poppy Bros Jr.]]

For more info, see their "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Poppy_Bros._Sr.]

title: poppy_bros_jr
body:
Poppy Bros Jr. are recurring enemies from the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby series]] that (in later games) grant the [[bomb kirby|Bomb]] [[copy ability]]. They look like little clowns, and toss bombs at [[Kirby]] to attack. For the larger, mid-boss variant, see [[poppy_bros_sr|Poppy Bros Sr.]]

For more info, see their "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Poppy_Bros._Jr.]

On top of that, the [[copy_ability|Copy Abilities]] have been greatly expanded upon, with many new ones being introduced and most of the returing ones gaining intricate movesets.

Has a remake for the [[Nintendo DS]], [[Kirby Super Star Ultra]].

title: aegyo_sal
body:
A term used in Korea referring to the small, [b]puffy[/b] fatty deposits underneath the eyes that are said to give a person a more youthful appearance.

Commonly seen in artwork from non-Japanese East Asian countries, such as Korea and China. Certain fashion styles also often use [[eyeshadow under eye|lower eye makeup]] that accentuates this area, such as [[gyaru]] and [[jirai kei]].

In contrast, most Western cultures see these raised discs of flesh under the eyes mostly in elderly people and associate them with poorly-aging seniors, makeup being geared to make eyes look more deep-set and the skin around them smoother.

Do not confuse with [[bags under eyes]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8195385
* !post #9330931

title: tag_group:pixiv_projects
body:
[See [[tag groups]].]

[[Pixiv]] website usually holds a lot of projects and drawing contests for various artists to join in and create arts. There are many different themes, guidelines and requirements for each of these. Images are mostly [[original]] creation, i.e. characters and scenes did not come from any established copyright.

h4. Themed collection

According to a certain theme, artists are free to draw any character they think of.

* [[Beast City Pixiv]]
* [[Celestial Stones]]
* [[Forest of Pixiv]]
* [[Muchigaku]]
* [[Oekaki Musume]]
* [[Otacool]]
** [[Otacool4]]
* [[Pixiv Azriel]]
* [[Pixiv Army]]
* [[Pixiv Automata]]
* [[Pixiv Card Battler]]
* [[Pixiv Cat Kingdom]]

title: nadine_chandrawinata
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]] & [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. An Indonesian huntress who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Nadine lost her parents in a landslide accident when she was 4 years old and was subsequently raised by animals. She was found 8 years later by a hunter who attempted to reintegrate her into human society, but she has great difficulty with human customs. Nadine is being studied by Aglaia due to her nearly perfect immune system, as she has never gotten sick.

Has [[dark skin]], [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Typically fights with either a [[bow_(weapon)|longbow]] or a [[crossbow]].

h4. Skins

title: gothic_punk
body:
Japanese fashion style derived from [[punk]] and [[goth fashion]], closely associated with [[visual kei]]. The fashion uses a lot of striped patterns, plaid, [[spikes]] and [[chain]]s, [[cross]] imagery, and [[arm warmers]] and [[leg warmers]]. Common color schemes include red + black, pink + black, and purple + black.

Hiki-Furisode (引き振袖, lit. "extended swinging sleeves", "pull sleeves") is a formal type of [[furisode]] (振袖, lit. swinging sleeves) which has the longest "skirt" length of all [[kimono]]. title: chainmail
body:
Armor made from small metal rings linked together into a mesh.  Also known as simply "mail" or "maille."

European garments made with mail are leggings (chausses), mail hoods (coif) and mail mittens (mitons). A mail collar hanging from a helmet is camail or aventail. A mail collar worn strapped around the neck was called a pixane or standard. A shirt made from mail is a hauberk if knee-length and a haubergeon if mid-thigh length.

Japanese chainmail is called [i]kusari[/i] (鎖, lit. "chain") and was used extensively alongside the more distinctive and better known lamellar armors.

h4. See also

* [[List of armor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chain mail":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chain_mail]

title: mare_(ac8231)
body:
[[ac8231]]'s [[original]] character
Has [[commission|commissioned]] countless artwork of her 
https://skeb.jp/@ac8231

https://x.com/ac8231/status/1774969507611881696
Mare Lunaris

The high-ranking vampire of the Moon Palace is a loyal servant of the former Demon King and is now the actual ruler of the Demon World. Contrary to what many believe, she does not consider herself the new Demon King and is still quietly waiting for her master's return. The Demon World is in chaos as she refuses to rule despite occupying the palace. She is prepared to mercilessly kill anyone who sets her sights on her master's throne.

Rumor has it that she has a twin sister, but the truth of this is unclear.

title: breath_weapon
body:
Used when a character, typically a [[dragon]], is exhaling some sort of magical energy.  This may take the form of [[breathing_fire|fire]], [[breathing_ice|ice]], [[breathing_lightning|lightning]] or any other form of magical energy.

Other common forms of breath weapon may include a poisonous breath, exhaling some form of disease or plague, colored energy bolts, raw arcane magic, raw life energy, or any other imaginable manifested energy.

h4. See Also:
* [[breathing fire]]
* [[breathing ice]]
* [[breathing lightning]]
* [[magic]]
* [[mouth beam]]

title: emile_bertin_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the one-off French Navy light cruiser [i]Émile Bertin[/i]. Character design by [[Oyari Ashito]], voiced by [[Ueda Reina]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with floating [[headgear]], [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[blue dress]] and [[aqua skirt]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[petticoat]] under her dress, [[aqua thighhighs]], and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces to her back, held together by her funnel. The hull pieces contain her two 152 mm triple gun mounts and 55 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]]. 

For her retrofit form, see her [[Emile bertin (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: shanghai_neckline
body:
A neckline whose name is derived from the "shanghai-style qipao" which uses the neckline, commonly seen in chinese clothes (but featured in non-chinese clothes as well) where the buttoning runs sideways downward from the collar, usually reaching to the side of the bust. The collar itself is often a [[mandarin collar]], but it can be of any type. 

This general shape of neckline has been around since the [[ming dynasty]], and were then worn with [[metal pankou]] and a standing collar. During the [[qing dynasty]] the style was heavily influenced by [[manchu clothes]] and had fabric [[pankou]]. Similar styles have been adapted all over the sinosphere, like on Vietnamese [[ao dai]] and the the mongolian [[deel]]. 

H4. Examples 
* !post #7860608: with [[pankou]] 
* !post #9262073: in the [[ming dynasty]]

title: jiaoqiu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. Voiced by [[Toyonaga Toshiyuki]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed as a [[fox boy|Foxian]] with matching [[fox ears|ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]], and [[orange eyes]] that he normally keeps closed. His outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with a [[Mandarin collar]], [[red jacket]], [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on his left hand, dark [[blue pants]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7732466: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]

"No matter how many times I say it, people always forget — cooking is medicine, and making medicine is cooking. Using food to treat the sick is my specialty. As the saying goes, a chef who doesn't want to be a healer isn't worth his salt... or pepper, for that matter."

A foxian healer from the Xianzhou Yaoqing and a counselor. Often greets people with a smile, but is rather cunning.
Born into a prestigious Alchemy Commission family, he once withdrew from practicing medicine due to a broken heart. However, he returned to the field to treat "the Merlin's Claw," General Feixiao.

Skilled in the study of alchemical prescription that views food as medicine, especially those that induce a sensation of spiciness. They invented a cauldron-based medicinal formula known as the "nine-squared grid."

[/expand]

There are two image songs of the game, "Heart no Jishaku" and "Hitomi no Knife", sung by [[Hidaka Noriko]]. Her in-game counterpart was called "Sherry":[http://wiki.ultimacodex.com/wiki/Sherry_(Noriko_Hidaka)] in the English translation.

title: kirby's_return_to_dream_land
body:
The second [[Kirby (series)|]] game released for the Nintendo [[Wii]] after [[Kirby's Epic Yarn]].

This game returns to the traditional game mechanics the franchise is known for (hence the American name). The main attraction here is the ability for three additional players to jump in at any time to make the game a co-op quest. It would later be remade for the Nintendo Switch, with visual upgrades and new features.

It also has a remake on the [[Nintendo Switch]], titled [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]], with several new modes and Copy Abilities.

title: doom_(comic)
body:
1996 comic book adaptation of the video game [[Doom (series)|]], where the [[Doomguy]] runs into a [[Cyberdemon]] and has to find a [[bfg 9000|really big gun]] to take it out.

Infamous for being so bad it's good, with some of its more noteworthy lines ("[[Rip and tear (phrase)|]]!" and "You are huge! That means you have huge guts!") being used in [[Doom (2016)]], [[Doom Eternal]] and [[Doom: The Dark Ages]].

title: kabuki_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] from a special episode of [i][[Kirby: Right Back at Ya!]][/i], also making a cameo appearance in [i][[Kirby Mass Attack]][/i]. Kabuki Kirby has a blue outfit similar to [[Freeze Kirby]]'s hood, wields a staff, and can shoot a large laser. When he first appears in the anime, Kabuki Kirby takes the form of a human [[kabuki]] actor.

title: kraft_univa_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]].

Her name is actually based off of 2 IRL horses trained by Tsutomu Setoguchi, who trained Oguri Cap IRL: [b][[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|]][/b] and [b][[Neo Universe (umamusume)|]][/b]. Neither horses were in [i]Umamusume[/i] at the time.

title: rip_and_tear_(phrase)
body:
[i]"You are huge! That means you have huge guts! Rip and tear! Rip and tear your guts!"[/i]

An famous line from the [[Doom (comic)|Doom comic book]], later used in [[Doom (2016)|the 2016 reboot]], [[Doom Eternal]], and [[Doom: The Dark Ages]].

title: magolor_soul
body:
[quote]
[i]“A sad shell possessed by the limitless power of the [[Master Crown]], no more than a manifestation of the crown itself.”[/i]

— VS Magolor Soul • [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i]
[/quote]

A stronger version of [[magolor|Magolor's]] [[magolor (2nd form)|second boss form]], appearing at the very end of Extra Mode.

At the tail-end of [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]]'s[/i] True Arena, he gains a significantly more powerful and dangerous moveset, bringing him up-to-speed with later "Soul" bosses like [[Soul of Sectonia]], [[star_dream|Star Dream Soul OS]], [[void_(kirby)|Void]], and [[Chaos Elfilis]]. During the battle, after he takes enough damage, he will also lose his white oval eyes, leaving only the single red eye inside his mouth.

title: kirby_for_nintendo_gamecube
body:
A cancelled [i][[Kirby (series)|]][/i] game for the Nintendo GameCube. This would've seen the return of Helpers from [i][[Kirby Super Star]][/i] and its remake. Material from the game was heavily reused for other [i]Kirby[/i] games, especially [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].

Tags marked with an asterisk are absent from [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].

title: botsusan
body:
Botsusan is the Japanese fan nickname of a character design from the scrapped [i][[Kirby for Nintendo GameCube]][/i]. It can be seen on page 117 in the [i]20th Anniversary Hoshi no Kirby Pupupu Taizen[/i].

Botsusan has large, black and white striped horns emitting dark flames. The character also has angry yellow eyes hidden behind a cloak, a shadowy body, lots of jewelry, and [[Rayman limbs|floating skeletal hands]] with red fingernails.

The design shares similarity with [spoiler][[Traitor Magolor]][/spoiler] from [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].

title: gelgoog_s_char_custom
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

The [b]MS-14S Gelgoog Commander Type[/b] is an early production variant of the [[Gelgoog]] (also referred to as the YMS-14) with higher specs, intended to be used by ace pilots. The most famous example is the red unit piloted by the Red Comet, [[Char Aznable]], who battled [[Amuro Ray]] and the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] on a nearly equal footing.

title: hermes_trismegistus_(overlord)
body:
A sturdy three-part suit of pitch-black armor crafted in the resemblance of a devil. A pair of horns would sprout across both sides of the helm while the exterior surface of the suit is covered with spikes. Aside from the thinly carved slit that serves as a visor, the armor does not reveal even the tiniest exposure of flesh.

The innermost layer is an assimilation armor in liquid form which fits the body perfectly and enhances physical abilities. The next layer is a complete full-body armor layer, like an undershirt. And finally, the outermost layer covers the inner layers and increases defenses even more. In order, the layers break by: 1) additional armor, 2) full-body armor, and 3) assimilation armor.

title: zastava_yugo
body:
A [[car]] manufactured by [[Zastava Automobiles]] from 1980 until 2008. Unlike previous Zastava cars, such as the [[Fiat 600|Zastava 750/850]], which were foreign models made under license, the Yugo was notably designed by Zastava with Fiat support. From 1988, it would also named the Zastava Koral.

In the mid-80s, the Yugo would be exported abroad with help from Malcolm Bricklin, competing with other Eastern cars being exported at the time, such as the [[Fiat 126|Polski Fiat 126p]] and [[Skoda Favorit]]. The Yugo would end up acquiring a reputation as the "worst car of all time" in the West, unhelped by foreign models having more faults than the domestic models, while it is remembered fondly in former Yugoslavia.

title: percival_(dream_portrait)_(fate)
body:
[quote]
Celebrating Fate/Grand Order's 7th Anniversary!

Take a trip down memory lane to mark this momentous occasion.

What would things be like now if that fateful encounter had happened differently?
Maybe we'd be looking at Heroic Spirits in completely new outfits.

Let's take this occasion to look back on the day we first met and imagine "what if..."
[/quote]

title: nyanko_daisensou
body:
A free-to-play Tower Defense game for iOS and Android devices published by PONOS in 2012. 

The game also has two alternate versions in Korean (고양이 대전쟁 [i]goyang-i daejeonjaeng[/i]) and English ('[b]The Battle Cats[/b]').

title: shikanai_konoha_(leafchan)
body:
An [[original]] character of [[Leafchan]], a girl who is, by a leaf spirit, forced to wear a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[leaf clothing]] (perceived by others as an ordinary school uniform) while at school in order to earn a wish.

The major complication is that if she covers herself in embarrassment, the glamour making her clothes appear normal fades for 3 minutes -- and anyone who sees her while it has faded becomes immune to the glamour from then on.  However, the spell that turns her clothes into leaf clothes is permanent and out of her control, so her situation would become significantly more embarrassing if she ever makes a mistake.

title: act_zaku
body:
A fictional military manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV series from 1985.

[b]MS-11 Act Zaku[/b]

A late development of the original [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]], the purple colored Act Zaku notably used field motors for its mechanical joints, rather than the fluid pulse system used by most [[Zeon]] MS. Its joints also underwent magnet coating treatment, greatly improving its mobility. Thanks to improved generator output, it was able to use beam weapons, including a custom beam rifle. 

Following the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]], the [[Earth Federation]] began mass producing the Act Zaku now with dark blue colors. The Federation-produced units were equipped with a linear seat cockpit, the BR-87A [[Beam Rifle]] used by the similar looking [[Hizack]], as well as a pair of beam sabers.

title: hyunwoo_(black_survival)
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]] & [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. A Korean high school delinquent who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Tends to fight with his fists.

Has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[red eyes]].

title: suzuki_aya
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]] and [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. A Japanese rookie [[policewoman]] who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She is known to have a poor sense of direction and panics easily, but she is also obsessed with the idea of justice.

She has [[brown hair]] worn in [[pigtails]], [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and wears [[glasses]].

title: greener_light_harpoon_gun
body: A weapon/tool made by the English sporting arms firm of W.W. Greener, the Greener Light Harpoon Gun is a rifle-like device based on the Martini action (best known from the British Army's [[Martini-Henry]] rifle) and uses .38 Special blanks to propel a steel harpoon. Though primarily a whaling and fishing implement, the Greener can also be used as a line thrower.  Its most prominent appearance in popular culture was in the 1975 motion picture [i][[jaws_(movie)|Jaws]][/i].

title: jackie_quilt
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]] & [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. A serial killer known for cutting her victims into so many pieces that one would need to stitch the remains together like a quilt to identify them. She willingly participates in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island, unlike many of the other Test Subjects, because it allows her to murder people without repercussions. Despite what her personality may suggest, she is considered [i]clinically sane[/i]. As a first-generation Test Subject, she is also immune to having her memories altered after each of Aglaia's experiments.

Has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and is covered in [[scar]]s. Often wields a [[chainsaw]].

[spoilers]Her real name is Angela Winslair, and her parents were her first victims as a serial killer.[/spoilers]
